# Day 3: Levels of biodiversity

2023-06-27

## Species concepts

- There is no one right answer to the question, "What are species?" 「種とは何か？」に対する正解はない

- Instead, there are different **species concepts** その代わり、複数の種概念がある

## Biological Species Concept (BSC)<br>生物学的種概念

- According to the BSC, species are groups of individuals that can **interbreed** with each other, but not other species
  - interbreed = 繁殖する

- Appearance does not matter
  - 見た目は関係ない

## Why the BSC?

- Members of the same species **can exchange genes** 同じ種同士で遺伝子の交換が可能

- Members of different species cannot 別種では不可能

- Member of the same species are an **evolutionary unit** だから、同じ種に属しているメンバーは進化的な単位をなす

## Why measure biodiversity using species?

生物多様性を種で測る理由は？

. . .

- Conceptually simple　わかりやすい

- According to the BSC, we are preserving evolutionary units　生物種概念によると、進化的な単位の保全ができている

## Are there any disadvantages to measuring biodiversity with species richness?

生物多様性を種で測る欠点は？

. . .

- Does not account for evolutionary history 種の進化的な歴史を無視してしまう

- The BSC is difficult to test experimentally 生物学的種概念は実験による検証が難しい

- The BSC does not apply to all organisms 生物学的種概念は全ての生物に応用ができない

## Biodiversity is not just about species

- Diversity exists **within** species 種の中にも生物多様性が存在する

- Species have **evolutionary history** 種には進化的な歴史がある

## Populations with low genetic diversity are vulnerable {.smaller}

:::: {.columns}

## Connections matter, not order of tips

You may read the tips left to right, but that does not mean the tip on the right is "more evolved". 系統樹を読む際は左から右へとラベルを読むかもしれないけど、右の種は「より進化した」わけではない。

![](https://evolution.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/notspecializedtree.gif)

::: {.medsmall}
https://evolution.berkeley.edu/the-tree-room/evolutionary-trees-a-primer/tips-for-tree-reading/
:::

## Connections matter, not order of tips

The same tree can be represented multiple ways. 一つの系統関係には複数の表し方がある。

![](https://evolution.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/equivalenttrees.gif)

## Group Activity: Build a phylogenetic tree

Build a phylogenetic tree including: owl, carp, rhinoceros, frog, starfish

![](../images/phylo_tree_activity.png)

## Build a phylogenetic tree: Step 1

List characteristics of each species 共通に持っている特徴を探す

![](../images/phylo_tree_activity_traits.png)

## Build a phylogenetic tree: Step 2

Convert the list into a matrix リストをマトリックスに変換する

![](../images/phylo_tree_activity_matrix.png)

## Build a phylogenetic tree: Step 3

Use the matrix to build a concentric circles diagram (Venn diagram) マトリックスを使って同心円図（ベン図）を作る

![](../images/phylo_tree_activity_venn.png)

## Build a phylogenetic tree: Step 4

Connect species from the Venn diagram to build the tree ベン図から種をつなげて系統樹を作る

![](../images/phylo_tree_activity_tree.png)

## Build a phylogenetic tree: Step 5

Indicate on the tree where the characteristics evolved その特徴がどこで進化したのかを系統樹に示す。

![](../images/phylo_tree_activity_tree_traits.png)
